headline: Taco Dip
description: This tasty taco dip recipe features a spicy layer of cream cheese and sour cream, topped with lettuce, cheese, tomato, and bell pepper. Happy dipping!

video.description: This simple dip features all your favorite taco toppings in delicious dip form.
video.name: Taco Dip I

name: Taco Dip
recipeIngredient: 0.25 head iceberg lettuce - rinsed, dried, and shredded

recipeInstructions.text: Mix sour cream, cream cheese, and taco seasoning together in a medium bowl until smooth. Spread mixture in a 9- or 10-inch round serving dish.
Top with shredded lettuce, then sprinkle Cheddar cheese, tomatoes, bell pepper, and black olives on top.

review.reviewBody: Turned out great! Pretty much followed the recipe and added a finely chopped jalapeÃ±o as well as 1 chopped sweet pepper. Additionally, topped it with chopped green onion. If I make it again, I may add a bit more taco seasoning to the base, felt like it could have used a bit more flavor. Am taking it to a Super Bowl party tonight!

I made this twice and it was a big hit! Both times, I served it with taco sauce on the side. The first time, I added green onions, and the second time, I added red onions. I got compliments both times! I also like the idea of adding jalapeno peppers which I plan to try next time!
Fun to make and Oh So Delicious ðŸ˜‹
This is the recipe I always use. I copy the base/dip exactly but I add some different toppings. Instead of green pepper, I use jalapeno pepper on half.
Soooo goood highly recommended made many times
One of my favorite dips. My niece loves it.
Tastes great and was very easy to make. Me and my family love this recipe!
Great recipe. I only used 2 tomatoes and half a green bell pepper. Also, I added an extra half cup of cheese and used 8 Oz of a shredded lettuce bag
So easy and delicious! Like another reviewer, I top mine with salsa.
So easy to make.
Iâ€™ve made this a couple of times and get happy results from my grandchildren..
I made it vegan, with Yves plant based pepperoni, and it was good, it even got the approval of my non vegan sister and I will diffidently make it again

This has been my "go-to" for many years! I add chopped red onion to the toppings list as I love them and they add nice color, but are also easy to see for those that don't care for them. Green onions are also a tasty topping if red is too strong.
I did use a can of retried beans on the bottom. This was a really good dip.
This used to be a standard at family parties 30 years ago. I was glad to find the recipe again. Guests love it!
Great! Just added green onions on top. and used sweet orange pepper

Great recipe for any party or get together! Quick and easy. Used pico de gallo instead of tomatoes and green peppers.
***To avoid soupy dip make sure lettuce is dried very well! Enjoy!!
Turned out beautiful very good!

Still taste as good as it did when I made it years ago, but misplaced it. 
A friend requested it for a party. 
Thanks
Quick and easy, I added yogurt instead of sour cream and added nacho spice from Epicure. Everyone loved it!
very good
Always the first to go! My grandaughter requests this every year for our Holiday get togethers!
Awesome!
Was kinda soupy
Made this for a work pot luck and everyone loved it! I absolutely love the video I watched it several times before attempting

I used my food processor to chop the vegetables and used garlic and onion powder instead of garlic salt and fresh onion. I seasoned the chopped vegetable with the onion and garlic powders instead of the cream cheese, sour cream, and taco seasoning mixture.
I was super easy and quick to make. My guests raved about how good it was.
I make this for tailgates and people love it!

I have been making this for a many years! Always a hit!! I always leave the cream cheese out before I start to make it, so it's easier to mix with the sour cream and taco seasoning. 
On top of that, I just use, lettuce, tomatoes and cheese. 
I want some now, since I'm talking about it!! :) hahahaaaaa

It was soooo good!!!! Since I didnâ€™t have any sour cream I used plain Greek yogurt and added refried beans.

Iâ€™d definitely make this recipe again.

I make this a lot and it is always a hit.
Usually I serve it on a pretty tray (seasonal decoration stuff). 
I use different types of lettuce (and abundantly) depending on the season (Spinach/romaine/spring mix). I layer just about anything I have in the veggie drawer. Tomatoes/Cucumber/colored peppers/onion/once I used carrots (For color) -- depending upon the lettuce I used. Then I add shredded cheese (sometimes smoked guoda) and sometimes olives (black or green). 
My husband and I like to take a snack to a brewery/tap room. This is healthy and tasty -- the spice is good with beer.

love this recipe since I was a kid. now I make it but add cooked venison burger to the mixture of cream cheese and sour cream so look at ten more minutes of prep. you can use lean ground beef or chicken too. I just never have. with just 4 people this thing is gone in 15 mins. love it. always make just before you wanna serve also.

I donâ€™t know why others say itâ€™s runny ...
This turned out great. Of course you can change up the toppings. I added a touch of refried beans on top of my cheese mixture before adding other indgredients. Mmmm!
Made this exactly as the recipe states. Everyone loved it. The only change I'd make next time is a bit less sour cream.
This is your basic taco dip and exactly what it should taste like. Made cream cheese mixture the night before. It's best to remove the seedy part of the tomato to avoid it turning out too soggy.

Made this for the Patriots game & it was awesome!! (Just like the Pats!!!) I followed the directions exactly & everyone loved it! I used corn chips & Fritos for dipping. Next time I make it I will use medium fresh salsa instead of the tomatoes. I think it will give it a little kick. You should definitely try to make this. Yummy!!

I switched the bell pepper to 4 sliced green onions, as I don't care for bell peppers. Also added a cup of guacamole after the refried bean mixture. Then I covered it with the sour cream. It is delicious!

Everyone at party I brought it to loved it! I recommend whipping cream cheese in mixer first then slowly adding sour cream to keep it from clumping. I drained salsa and put it on top of mixture right before serving, then cheese then lettuce and tomato. Omitted olives as I donâ€™t like them. Very tasty and very easy. If one likes beans those would be great addition.
The only thing I didnâ€™t use was the green pepper. I prefer chopped green onions instead. This was a great recipe!! Thanks.
Definitely beat the softened cream cheese prior to adding cream cheese
Super easy and very pretty. This recipe makes a lot and it is delicious!
This was very good. I added quite a bit of cayenne pepper to the sour cream mixture, omitted the bell peppers, added some salsa and put sliced jalapenos on top as our family loves the extra kick.
I leave out the olives and put in green onions.

I make this all the time but leave off the lettuce, tomatoes, peppers & olives as my kids are a little fussy. Still a great dip even with only the cheese as a topping. Great for use with Tostitos! Highly recommend !!

This is a very easy recipe. Hard to mess it up. Makes a light and refreshing appy that easily serves 8. I actually served this to 8 of my husband's hungry coworkers as a pre-BBQ appetizer and it disappeared FAST! While I was in the kitchen prepping the rest of our dinner I overheard several of the guys comment "man, this is sooooo good!" :) Made me super happy as I am a bit of a foodie, and I thought this might be too simple or maybe too old school for this mixed group of mostly executives. Glad I took a chance on it ! It was a total hit! Yayyy! AND Best of all, my cool little secret was I used full fat, Greek style yogurt instead of sour cream (because I didn't have time to run out to buy sour cream) Nobody noticed! Shows how versatile this recipe is. Will make this again when I need a quick, light appy for a dinner party.
for speed & ease! added a refried bean layer on the bottom
I will definitely make it again

I love this recipe. I have changed it a little by adding plain Greek yogurt instead of the sour cream and instead of a package of taco mix I make my own (recipe on All recipes) this way I can control the salt, I actually don't put any in).
This whipped up in about 7 minutes. Very tasty.
It was very tasty. The taco seasoning gave it a great kick. Even though I love cream cheese, I found it a bit heavy. I would try using half the cream cheese next time.
It disappeared in a flash! I added a little more chili powder to spice it up a bit but it was great even without the extra spice.

Used all vegetarian sour cream, cream cheese, and shredded cheddar. No one could tell the difference. Substituted black beans for the olives. It was delish and a big hit on game day. Will definitely make this again!
Huge hit at our Christmas party, will definitely make it again!
Added ground beef and green onions to it and it is fabulous
I make a similar version, adding the sour cream made it sooo much better!! I only used 8oz sour cream though. Oh, and sliced green olives!
Great Recipe !!!! made as written.....
I made it as shown except I subbed fresh salsa for the tomatoes. It was pretty good! My guests ate some but I did have quite a bit left over. Not sure if I'd make again.
I mixed Chipotle sauce with refried beans and added a bottom layer. Wasn't any left at the end of my LipSense party
Made for a baby shower. Was very good.

I have been using this recipe for a few years. It is such a hit. I use regular sour cream though, which is probably stupid because I could save calories and fat. Easy to make, except lots of cutting. Huge hit all the time!

I thought this was very good. It was a little bit bland but still good. I left out the green peppers. I did what others suggested and beat the cream cheese before adding the other ingredients. I used two cups of Mexican cheese blend. I also had leftover ground beef on hand and mixed that into the cream cheese mixture. I think this dip would be great heated as well! I wonder if letting this dip sit overnight would help the flavors blend?

I loved this! I made it for a small get together (doubling the ingredients filled a 9x13 casserole dish). Using low fat ingredients didnt change the taste at all (when compared to other taco dips I've had). I had a LOT of left overs so I ate it on some bagels I had and warmed them in the oven at 350 for about 5 mins. My new favorite snack!
Was good! Will try sour cream instead of cream cheese next time
No additional suggestions
I made it for my Super Bowl party and everyone loved it! I skipped the bell peppers and added a layer of refried beans for the bottom layer. I will definitely make again!
I made this recipe exactly as stated and my family loved it.

The only thing I do differently is add a can of refried beans on the bottom layer & leave out the lettuce, it just wilts too much & tastes too soggy for our taste buds. I do sprinkle a tiny bit of cayenne pepper (about 1/8 tsp) over the bean dip. Always gets eaten to the last speck w/plain nacho chips.!!! Yum! ??
Made this for a day out on the boat and everyone kept asking who made this? I used the cheesy burrito mix instead and it was perfect!!
I make this all the time, everyones loves it! Tho I do add fresh cilantro and a few drops of lime juice!

on top of the cream chez, sour cream, taco layer I spread a jar of salsa then topped with the rest of ingredients - been a favorite of my friends and family for 20 years for every party there is none left

Left out the shredded lettuce, but then followed recipe exactly. Very easy to make & tastes good. I will spice it up more the next time I make it as I personally prefer a spicier flavor . Good, quick easy recipe.

I have made this a number of times for all types of gatherings. Every time I have made this, there was never any left. My son absolutely loves it and am making it again for our vacation in Wildwood. Gotta have a good dip while sitting next to the bonfires. :) Thanks for a easy and great recipe.

I made this for myself and 4 girlfriends, and we inhaled it! This is my new go to taco dip recipe; it is so delicious and easy! I did alter the ingredients slightly, which I think made it much better. I used half the amount of sour cream and used green onion instead of green pepper. I also spread some mild taco sauce on top of the cream cheese/sour cream layer (I would have preferred medium or hot) for extra flavor. I didn't measure anything, just eyeballed it. Be sure to beat the cream cheese well, or it will be clumpy.
first

Very easy to make, i omit the green pepper, but i do add a jar of mild salsa, helps with the flavor and makes it much easier to mix together, i also mix the cheese INTO it so that with every bite you get some cheese. If you add the salsa, you should let it chill for 30-60 min!
I make this dip quite often when we entertain and it is always a hit! Many, many people have asked me for the recipe after.

This is always a favourite at any party's we have at our house as well as any gatherings we go to. So easy to make & the dish is always scraped clean. I do not add green pepper or olives. Everyone raves about this dish ??
This is delicious!

I love this recipe! So easy and good. I get requests from family to make this taco dip a lot. One thing I like about this is there are no beans in this dip. An alternative to the taco dips that have refried beans in it etc...
Before this was ever posted, my grandma has made this for about 40 years. this is the closest recipe i can find for hers. We make it for every family event/ holiday!
Used one bar and one tub cream cheese with the sour cream and taco seasoning. Then, chunky salsa, shredded lettuce, Mexican cheese, diced tomatoes, green onions. Delicious!
Beat cream cheese alone first, then add sour cream. I added 2 cans of refried beans to it. Also added sliced bk olives on top.
Beat cream cheese alone first, then add sour cream. I added 2 cans of refried beans to it. Also added sliced bk olives on top.

I made this for our Secret Santa party and it was a huge hit! I swapped out the green peppers for green onions. I also beat the cream cheese first and then added the sour cream. This is now in my rotation of party dishes!

Made this for my annual Chrismukkah party and it was a big hit. Followed the recipe exactly as written except I omitted the lettuce as I had none on hand. Brought the cream cheese to room temperature and then using a wisk I mixed in the sour cream and taco seasoning. Refrigerated it overnight then right before the party I added the toppings. Will make again! Note to self: a 35 gram pack of taco seasoning is equal to 1.25 oz.

I made it without lettuce or green peppers because I was out of both. I added diced blanched jalapeÃ±o peppers and a small amount of diced red onion. It was still great. My 13yo daughter loved it. It was our first attempt to make a dip similar to the one at Festival Foods in Wisconsin.

I have made this many times. Every time I do it's gone fast. When I take it to party's everyone raves about it and it's gone before you know it. I however only add topping that I like(lettuce, tomatoes and cheese). Also it has been stated before but you should always beat the cream cheese first to make sure it doesn't clump.
Sorry way to much sour cream I like mine a bit thicker

I have been looking for a good taco dip recipe for ages.

This is my all time favourite. I keep coming back to this one and it sure is a crowd pleaser !!!
I make this for any get together I'm invited to. I always add a thin layer of taco sauce on top of the cream cheese mixture. Definitely makes a delicious difference.
It was to easy to make but I heated the cream cheese for 1 minute in the microwave and it made it easier to mix the other ingredients.

When we make this dip, we do not mix the cream cheese and sour cream, it's too runny that way. We spread the cream cheese on the platter and sprinkle the taco season on that. Then build the layers. If you're making it the night before, prep all your ingredients, but don't put the tomatoes and lettuce on until just before serving so the water doesn't escape the veggies. 

It's really good, and people eat a ton of it at parties!

I let the cream cheese soften at room temperature but when i combined all my ingredients it started to clump and that's when i busted out the food processor/blender. Now it's smooth and creamy. The day is saved! Otherwise, great and easy recipe, and wonderful taste!
was good i skipped the olives and lettuce as well. added a blended cheese mixture salsa layer with yellow and red pepper and green onion. added fine chopped tomatoe and shredded spinach on top
Delicious! I did leave green pepper out, not a big fan.
Good and esy.
Don't rinse the head lettuce, the lettuce will get water-logged and this dip will not turn out. Take the first 3-4 outer leaves off the lettuce and you're good to go.
I really like this dip. I made the recipe dip for my work potluck. Huge hit. Also added the cayenne pepper into the mix. I really like the jalapeÃ±os for a delicious spicy kick.

Very tasty and easy to make. I agree with another that the cream cheese should be beaten first. I had lumps of cream cheese that didn't mix. I also think it would be improved upon by adding refried beans to the bottom...just my personal preference. I will add them if I make this recipe again.
But if your looking for a quick and flavorful dip, this fits the bill.
It's a hit at every party and my go to because I can set it up the night before an be good to go. Love it!!
